lead_paragraph: Despite recent improvements in the health of European banks, they remain vulnerable to a daunting array of hazards that are expected to produce another round of sizable write-offs during the next couple of years, the European Central Bank said Monday, in a report that cataloged in alarming detail the problems facing the region's financial institutions, Jack Ewing reports in The New York Times.
snippet: Borrowing costs could rise as European banks compete with governments in the bond market.

headline.main: E.C.B.'s Report Issues Warning for Banks

abstract: Borrowing costs could rise as European banks compete with governments in the bond market.
